title: Here is a list of 20 articles published before 2022 that focus on dataset annotation aggregation and interpreting multiple expert annotators
Maximum likelihood estimation of observer error-rates using the EM algorithm"
container-title: Applied Statistics

title: This seminal paper introduces a method for estimating the error rates of multiple annotators using the Expectation-Maximization (EM) algorithm
Cheap and fast—but is it good? Evaluating non-expert annotations for natural language tasks"
container-title: Proceedings of the 2008 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing

title: This paper evaluates the quality of non-expert annotations and discusses methods for aggregating them
Learning from crowds"
container-title: Journal of Machine Learning Research

title: The authors propose a probabilistic model for learning from multiple annotators with varying levels of expertise
Get another label? Improving data quality and data mining using multiple, noisy labelers"
container-title: Proceedings of the 14th ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining

title: This paper discusses strategies for improving data quality by aggregating labels from multiple annotators
Whose vote should count more: Optimal integration of labels from labelers of unknown expertise"
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: The authors present a method for weighting annotators' votes based on their estimated expertise
The multidimensional wisdom of crowds"
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This paper extends the idea of aggregating annotations by considering multiple dimensions of annotator expertise
Quality management on Amazon Mechanical Turk"
container-title: Proceedings of the ACM SIGKDD Workshop on Human Computation

title: The authors discuss methods for managing and improving the quality of annotations obtained from crowdsourcing platforms
A Bayesian hierarchical model for learning from crowds"
container-title: Proceedings of the 25th International Conference on Machine Learning

title: This paper introduces a Bayesian hierarchical model for aggregating annotations from multiple annotators
Iterative learning for reliable crowdsourcing systems"
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: The authors propose an iterative algorithm for improving the reliability of crowdsourced annotations
Variational inference for crowdsourcing"
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This paper presents a variational inference approach for aggregating annotations from multiple annotators
Bayesian classifier combination"
container-title: Proceedings of the 15th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics

title: The authors propose a Bayesian approach for combining classifiers, which can be applied to aggregating annotations
Making better use of the crowd: How crowdsourcing can advance machine learning research"
container-title: Journal of Machine Learning Research

title: This survey paper discusses various methods and challenges in using crowdsourcing for machine learning, including annotation aggregation
Learning from the wisdom of crowds by minimax entropy"
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: The authors introduce a minimax entropy principle for aggregating annotations from multiple annotators
Who moderates the moderators? Crowdsourcing abuse detection in user-generated content"
container-title: Proceedings of the 12th ACM Conference on Electronic Commerce

title: This paper discusses methods for aggregating annotations in the context of abuse detection in user-generated content
Efficient ranking from pairwise comparisons"
container-title: Proceedings of the 30th International Conference on Machine Learning

title: The authors propose efficient algorithms for ranking items based on pairwise comparisons, which can be applied to annotation aggregation
The social impact of natural language processing"
container-title: Proceedings of the 54th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: This paper discusses the social implications of NLP, including the importance of high-quality annotations and methods for achieving them
Comparing Bayesian models of annotation"
container-title: Transactions of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: The authors compare different Bayesian models for aggregating annotations from multiple annotators
Deep learning from crowds"
container-title: Proceedings of the 32nd AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: This paper explores the use of deep learning techniques for aggregating annotations from crowds
An online learning approach to improving the quality of crowd-sourcing"
container-title: IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering

title: The authors propose an online learning approach for improving the quality of crowdsourced annotations
Multi-task learning from multiple annotators"
container-title: Proceedings of the 36th International Conference on Machine Learning

title: This paper presents a multi-task learning framework for aggregating annotations from multiple annotators

These articles cover a range of methods and approaches for aggregating annotations from multiple annotators, including probabilistic models, Bayesian methods, deep learning, and more. They provide a solid foundation for understanding the challenges and solutions in this area
